questions.question: Which of the following is listed as an essential element of Nigeria’s airworthiness regulatory system in the DAWS PPM?
options: Operation of air traffic control towers
questions.correctAnswer: Registration of aircraft
questions.hint: This refers to maintaining an official national aircraft register.
questions.funFact: The PPM explicitly lists registration of aircraft as a core element of the airworthiness regulatory system.

questions.question: Who within NCAA/DAWS is cited as the authorised person to approve amendments to the DAWS PPM?
questions.correctAnswer: Director, Airworthiness Standards (DAWS)
questions.hint: Authority for this manual remains within the directorate itself.
questions.funFact: The PPM states the Director of Airworthiness Standards is the sole authority for approving amendments.

questions.question: Which document does the PPM list as the primary technical guidance for Airworthiness Inspectors?
options: Technical Guidance Manual Vol. IV - Airworthiness Inspector's Handbook
questions.correctAnswer: Technical Guidance Manual Vol. IV - Airworthiness Inspector's Handbook
questions.hint: It is an inspector-focused technical guidance document.
questions.funFact: DAWS relies on Technical Guidance Manuals to standardise inspection procedures nationwide.

questions.question: When determining whether an aircraft is 'airworthy', the PPM states two basic conditions. One is conformity to type design. What is the other?
options: It must be in a condition for safe operation (no critical deterioration)
It must be less than 20 years old
It must have the manufacturer's approval for each flight
It must be operated only by licensed pilots
questions.correctAnswer: It must be in a condition for safe operation (no critical deterioration)
questions.hint: This focuses on physical condition rather than age or paperwork.
questions.funFact: Airworthiness requires both conformity to type design and a condition safe for operation.

questions.question: Which of the following duties is included in DAWS responsibilities related to Certificates of Airworthiness?
options: Issuance and renewal of Certificates of Airworthiness and related surveys
Issuance of pilot licences for private pilots
questions.correctAnswer: Issuance and renewal of Certificates of Airworthiness and related surveys
questions.hint: This duty relates directly to aircraft certification.
questions.funFact: DAWS oversees the full lifecycle of Certificates of Airworthiness.

questions.question: What is TFCC/Registry primarily responsible for in DAWS file handling?
options: Safe custody of files and keeping a register of file movements
questions.correctAnswer: Safe custody of files and keeping a register of file movements
questions.hint: This role focuses on custody and traceability.
questions.funFact: TFCC/Registry ensures all official technical files are tracked and safeguarded.

questions.question: According to the PPM, which files may only be opened by the TFCC/Registry?
options: Operator files, AOC/AMO files and Special Purpose/Project files
questions.correctAnswer: Operator files, AOC/AMO files and Special Purpose/Project files
questions.funFact: Restricted file opening preserves document integrity and accountability.

questions.question: What is the normal return time to TFCC for files taken by ASIs after action, as per the PPM?
questions.correctAnswer: 5 working days
questions.hint: It’s a short but reasonable turnaround period.
questions.funFact: The PPM limits file retention to maintain availability across units.

questions.question: When a file becomes bulky (over approximately 100 folios), TFCC must:
options: Close the file and open a new volume
Compress it into a single PDF and email it
Send it to the Director-General for permission
questions.correctAnswer: Close the file and open a new volume
questions.hint: This keeps files manageable and organised.
questions.funFact: Volume control prevents loss and damage to physical files.

questions.question: During file dispatch between regional offices and headquarters, the PPM requires:
options: Proper bagging, addressing and a recorded receipt of dispatch
Only an email notification without physical packaging
Sending files by commercial courier without records
No formal record keeping to speed up process
questions.correctAnswer: Proper bagging, addressing and a recorded receipt of dispatch
questions.funFact: Dispatch records maintain accountability during inter-office transfers.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Mandatory Occurrence Reporting (MOR) referenced in the DAWS PPM?
questions.correctAnswer: Safety reporting and incident analysis
questions.hint: It feeds into the State Safety Programme.
questions.funFact: MOR supports identification and analysis of safety deficiencies and incidents.

questions.question: If recurring defects are identified on aircraft systems, which system does DAWS use to capture and analyse such trends?
questions.correctAnswer: Service Difficulty Reporting (SDR) system
questions.hint: It focuses on defects and service difficulties.
questions.funFact: SDRs help regulators detect emerging technical risks before accidents occur.

questions.question: If an aircraft is suspected of being unairworthy, the PPM directs that the aircraft should be:
options: Regarded as unairworthy and withdrawn from service pending inspection and corrective action
Allowed to continue flying until proven unsafe
questions.correctAnswer: Regarded as unairworthy and withdrawn from service pending inspection and corrective action
questions.funFact: Suspected unairworthy aircraft must have their CofA revoked until rectified.

questions.question: Which DAWS activity determines whether foreign Airworthiness Directives apply to Nigerian-registered aircraft?
options: Review of foreign ADs and Service Bulletins to assess national applicability
Automatic adoption of all foreign directives
questions.correctAnswer: Review of foreign ADs and Service Bulletins to assess national applicability
questions.hint: Not all foreign directives automatically apply nationally.
questions.funFact: DAWS evaluates foreign safety actions before directing compliance nationally.

questions.question: What formal action may DAWS publish when an inspection identifies a mandatory safety corrective item?
options: An Airworthiness Directive directed to all operators
A service bulletin issued by manufacturers only
An advisory memo with voluntary compliance
questions.correctAnswer: An Airworthiness Directive directed to all operators
questions.hint: Mandatory corrective actions require formal regulatory instruments.
questions.funFact: Airworthiness Directives impose compulsory corrective actions on affected operators.

questions.question: Which DAWS unit is responsible for certification and surveillance of Approved Maintenance Organisations (AMOs)?
questions.correctAnswer: Approved Maintenance Organisation Certification & Surveillance (AMOC&S)
questions.hint: The name reflects both certification and oversight.
questions.funFact: AMOC&S oversees AMO approvals, manuals, and periodic surveillance.

questions.question: Which facility falls under AMOC&S inspection responsibilities according to the PPM?
options: Aviation fuel farms and fuelling facilities
questions.correctAnswer: Aviation fuel farms and fuelling facilities
questions.funFact: Fuel contamination poses a serious risk to aircraft safety.

questions.question: Which document must operators submit for DAWS approval to demonstrate continuing airworthiness management?
questions.correctAnswer: Continuing Airworthiness Management Exposition (CAME)
questions.hint: It outlines how airworthiness is continuously managed.
questions.funFact: CAME approval is essential for CAMO authorisation.

questions.question: When a foreign manufacturer issues a Service Bulletin affecting safety, DAWS should:
options: Assess applicability and determine if national corrective action is required
Ignore it unless an accident occurs
questions.correctAnswer: Assess applicability and determine if national corrective action is required
questions.funFact: Service Bulletins may lead to national ADs if safety is compromised.

questions.question: Following inspection findings requiring enforcement, DAWS proceeds in line with:
questions.correctAnswer: Nig.CARs compliance and sanctions procedures
questions.funFact: Sanctions are applied to ensure corrective compliance, not punishment alone.

questions.question: Which qualification path is acceptable for appointment as an Airworthiness Safety Inspector (ASI)?
options: Licensed maintenance engineer with approximately five years of experience
questions.correctAnswer: Licensed maintenance engineer with approximately five years of experience
questions.funFact: Engineering graduates may also qualify with appropriate training.

questions.question: What documentation must be maintained in an ASI training folder?
options: ID, credentials, CV, licences and training records
questions.correctAnswer: ID, credentials, CV, licences and training records
questions.hint: Professional records ensure traceability of competence.
questions.funFact: Training folders support inspector authorisation decisions.

questions.question: When asked to interpret regulations outside their expertise, an ASI should:
options: Request a written query for coordination with DAWS and Legal
questions.correctAnswer: Request a written query for coordination with DAWS and Legal
questions.funFact: Centralised interpretations ensure regulatory consistency.

questions.question: Which attributes best reflect the PPM’s expectations of an ASI?
options: Impartiality, integrity, tact and technical competence
questions.correctAnswer: Impartiality, integrity, tact and technical competence
questions.funFact: Professional conduct underpins regulatory credibility.

questions.question: Before being authorised to work independently, ASIs must complete:
options: Prescribed On-the-Job Training (OJT) and demonstrate competence
questions.correctAnswer: Prescribed On-the-Job Training (OJT) and demonstrate competence
questions.hint: Competence must be demonstrated, not assumed.
questions.funFact: OJT ensures inspectors apply theory correctly in real inspections.

questions.question: Before conducting a regional audit, inspection teams should review:
options: Latest technical manuals and previous DAWS reports
questions.correctAnswer: Latest technical manuals and previous DAWS reports
questions.funFact: Good preparation improves audit effectiveness.

questions.question: What is the role of the Principal Airworthiness Inspector (PAI)?
options: Lead inspector and primary contact for assigned operators or AMOs
questions.correctAnswer: Lead inspector and primary contact for assigned operators or AMOs
questions.funFact: PAIs ensure consistency in surveillance and certification.

questions.question: During audits, which documents should auditors verify for currency?
options: Maintenance manuals, CofA records and control documents
questions.correctAnswer: Maintenance manuals, CofA records and control documents
questions.funFact: Outdated manuals are a common audit finding.

questions.question: When planning an audit team, which information is essential?
options: Operator fleet types and documents to be audited
questions.correctAnswer: Operator fleet types and documents to be audited
questions.hint: Fleet type determines inspector expertise needed.
questions.funFact: Matching expertise to fleet type improves audit quality.

questions.question: How frequently must regional offices submit updates to DAWS headquarters?
questions.correctAnswer: Quarterly
questions.funFact: Regular reporting maintains national oversight visibility.

questions.question: Which DAWS unit oversees airworthiness aspects of Remotely Piloted Aircraft Systems (RPAS)?
questions.correctAnswer: Aircraft Certification and Continuing Airworthiness (ACCA)
questions.hint: RPAS oversight falls under certification and airworthiness.
questions.funFact: RPAS are regulated with airworthiness considerations similar to manned aircraft.

questions.question: Which practice supports aircraft part traceability?
options: Maintaining provenance records and monitoring Service Bulletins
questions.correctAnswer: Maintaining provenance records and monitoring Service Bulletins
questions.funFact: Unapproved parts are a major airworthiness risk.

questions.question: If a mandatory safety corrective item affects a fleet type, DAWS may issue:
questions.correctAnswer: An Airworthiness Directive
questions.funFact: ADs legally compel corrective action.

questions.question: When reviewing foreign safety actions, DAWS must:
questions.correctAnswer: Assess applicability to Nigerian-registered aircraft
questions.funFact: Applicability assessment prevents unnecessary operational disruption.

questions.question: If evidence of maintenance fraud is discovered, an inspector should:
options: Preserve evidence and initiate enforcement through proper channels
questions.correctAnswer: Preserve evidence and initiate enforcement through proper channels
questions.hint: Formal process protects integrity and legality.
questions.funFact: Improper handling of evidence can compromise enforcement cases.

questions.question: What must be included in an ASI’s monthly Record of Activities?
options: Tasks performed and time utilisation (minimum 40 hours per week)
questions.correctAnswer: Tasks performed and time utilisation (minimum 40 hours per week)
questions.funFact: Activity records support workload monitoring.

questions.question: Who is authorised to sign correspondence involving financial commitments?
questions.correctAnswer: Director, Airworthiness Standards or Director-General
questions.funFact: Senior sign-off ensures accountability.

questions.question: What should an executive summary of a technical assignment contain?
options: Findings and recommendations with references to detailed reports
questions.correctAnswer: Findings and recommendations with references to detailed reports
questions.funFact: Detailed evidence is retained in technical files.

questions.question: If deviation from a prescribed PPM procedure is necessary, the staff member must:
options: Notify the Director, DAWS with full justification
questions.correctAnswer: Notify the Director, DAWS with full justification
questions.funFact: Controlled deviations maintain procedural integrity.

questions.question: How should project work beyond routine tasks be managed?
options: Open a project control sheet and record time and costs
questions.correctAnswer: Open a project control sheet and record time and costs
questions.funFact: Project control supports transparency and billing accuracy.
